translations.translation: who are steeped in ignorance and heedlessness.
and who wander in the abyss of confusion.
Those who have forgotten in a state of intoxication.
Who are under a cover of Sahun,
Who are in a gulf (of ignorance) neglectful;
Who are careless in an abyss!
who flounder in the depths of ignorance.
Those who are in heedlessness neglectful.
who are heedless in a stupor!
Those who (flounder) heedless in a flood of confusion:
Who are under a cover of heedlessness (think not about the gravity of the Hereafter),
who are heedless in the immersion.
Those who are dazed in ignorance.
Who are within a flood [of confusion] and heedless.
[51:11] who are in a stupor, in ignorance that has stupefied them, heedless, oblivious of the matter of the Hereafter.
(Who are careless) oblivious to believing in Muhammad (pbuh) and the Qur'an (in an abyss!) in ignorance and blindness concerning the Hereafter.

commentaries.author: زيد بن علي
commentaries.text: وقوله تعالى: { ٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ فِي غَمْرَةٍ } يعني في شَكٍّ

commentaries.author: ابن عجيبة
commentaries.text: [عبس: 17] وأصله: الدعاء القتل والهلاك، ثم جرى مجرى " لُعِنَ " ، والخرَّاصون: الكذّابون المُقدِّرون ما لا صحة له، وهم أصحاب القول المختلف، كأنه قيل: لُعن هؤلاء الخراصون { الذي هم في غمرةٍ } في جهل يغمرهم، { ساهون } غافلون عما أُمروا به { يسألون أيّان يومُ الدين } أي: متى وقوع يوم الجزاء، لكن لا بطريق الاستعلام حقيقة، بل بطريق الاستعجال، استهزاء، فإنَّ " إيّان " ظرف للوقوع المقدّر لأن " أيّان " إنما يقع ظرفاً للحدثان
